inChI.title: In Ch I
inChI.description: Non-proprietary identifier for molecular entity that can be used in printed and electronic data sources thus enabling easier linking of diverse data compilations.

inChIKey.title: In Ch I Key
inChIKey.description: InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm).

iupacName.title: Iupac Name
iupacName.description: Systematic method of naming chemical compounds as recommended by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).

molecularFormula.title: Molecular Formula
molecularFormula.description: The empirical formula is the simplest whole number ratio of all the atoms in a molecule.

molecularWeight.title: Molecular Weight
molecularWeight.description: This is the molecular weight of the entity being described, not of the parent. Units should be included in the form '<Number> <unit>', for example '12 amu' or as '<QuantitativeValue>.

monoisotopicMolecularWeight.title: Monoisotopic Molecular Weight
monoisotopicMolecularWeight.description: The monoisotopic mass is the sum of the masses of the atoms in a molecule using the unbound, ground-state, rest mass of the principal (most abundant) isotope for each element instead of the isotopic average mass. Please include the units the form '<Number> <unit>', for example '770.230488 g/mol' or as '<QuantitativeValue>.

smiles.title: Smiles
smiles.description: A specification in form of a line notation for describing the structure of chemical species using short ASCII strings.  Double bond stereochemistry \ indicators may need to be escaped in the string in formats where the backslash is an escape character.
